授業目的: Students will understand how to use concepts and principles of politics and some economics, together with plausible evidence, to describe the interactions of political and economic actors and to explain the economic and political regime of the postwar Japan.
到達目標: （THE RELATION BETWEEN THE POLITY AND ECONOMY OF THE POSTWAR JAPAN）First, the course will seek to explain the economic growth of the postwar Japan.　We also discuss what is wrong and/or what went wrong since the 1990s. The second part will examine political regime of the postwar Japan.　The emphasis is on the roles that the politicians played for better or worse.  One of the objectives of this course is to think critically about competing theories of development （economists, sociologists, political scientists）.  In each part, one of the purposes of the course is to demystify mysterious element of “Japaneseness”in the political economy of Japan. Students are welcome to participate and bring various perspectives and experiences to the class.
